title: Is it true that conservatives are anti-science? - Quora

response.answer_text: Conservatives are a pretty diverse group, so its hard to generalize. If “conservatives” is meant to primarily describe staunch Republicans (which are a subset of conservatives), then the answer is that such Republicans will sacrafice science for political expediency. That does not literally make them anti-science, as they like science that does not create political issues. But any respect for science vanishes if science requires them to adjust their politics. Then they happily trash science in favor of propaganda. In a sense, such people are anti-science. Believing in science does not allow you to abandon facts and reasons in favor of political dogma, but they do it easily. Put another way, you are hardly pro-science if you can dump it whenever expedient. The better description is that they are agnostic about science, and willing to embrace anti-science if dictated by political dogma. Currently, scientists identify far more with Democrats than Republicans, and that is a more recent phenomena (in the past, they were somewhat conservative as a group). I would ascribe that trend to the willingness of Republicans to trash science in favor of political dogma. Its hard to attract a group when their core value is treated like dirt. A data point on this trend was Scientific American endorsing Biden.
